TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void ContextChangedEventHandler(object sender, ContextChangedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ContextChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub ContextChangedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As ContextChangedEventArgs)
public delegate void ContextChangedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, ContextChangedEventArgs ^ e);
type ContextChangedEventHandler = delegate of obj * ContextChangedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a form.

remarks.para: The code skeleton for an event handler associated with the ContextChanged event, which uses the ContextChangedEventHandler delegate, should be added only from the Microsoft InfoPath user interface. For more information on how to add event handlers in InfoPath, see How Do I: Add an Event Handler.

example.para: For an example of using the ContextChangedEventHandler delegate, see the sample code in the ContextChanged event of the class.
